items.summary: arXiv:2602.07114v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We present the splashback radius analysis of the Adaptive Matched Identifier of Clustered Objects (AMICO) galaxy cluster sample in the fourth data release of the Kilo Degree Survey (KiDS). The sample contains 9049 rich galaxy cluste…

items.title: Exploring the dynamical evolution of binary stars in multiple-population globular clusters
items.summary: arXiv:2602.07119v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The presence of multiple stellar populations in globular clusters leads to a complex dynamical environment that significantly influences the evolution of binary stars, which in turn impacts the evolution of the cluster itself. For t…

items.title: AGN versus Star-formation: A MUSE Analysis of NGC 1365
items.summary: arXiv:2602.07124v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Active galactic nuclei (AGN) and star formation feedback may heat and remove gas from galaxies in a process that quenches ongoing star formation and shapes the evolution of galaxies. Potential impacts from these processes can be see…

items.title: A New Strategy for Using Spectroscopic Phase Curves to Characterize Non-Transiting Planets
items.summary: arXiv:2602.07127v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce a new time-series analysis strategy for combined-light exoplanet spectroscopic phase curves called the Variable Planetary Infrared Excess (VPIE) method. VPIE can be used to extract information about the planetary flux c…
